options.name: Culture of Festivals
options.description: The Goblin culture is happy to celebrate even minor occassions. Gain +1 Persuasion and Gain +1 Performance

options.name: Studier of Artifacts
options.description: You gain +1 Academics and +1 Runecarving. You gain a 1d4 Bonus to Checks when attempting to deduce the origin of an Object or Structure.

options.name: Magical Builders
options.description: The masons and architects in the Goblin culture build and design with magic. Learn 3 Beginner and 3 Novice Transmutation Spells.

options.name: Appreciation for the Arts
options.description: The Goblin culture is enamored by beauty. You can spend a minute admiring either an artifact, a piece of art or architecture to borrow inspiration. The object in question must be at least 100 years old, valued over 100 gold and something that has not been the target of this ability in the past. If you are successfully inspired, you gain a 1d4 Bonus to Performance Checks for the rest of the day and a 1d4 Bonus to your next Craft Check. If the 1d4 on the Craft Check results in a 4, add 1 Overcraft to the Object.

options.name: Meritocracy
options.description: Those who excel in crafting beautiful objects are the ones who advance within the Goblin society. Gain +1 to all Crafting Skills.

options.name: Those Who Covet
options.description: With a culture defined by such beautiful and expensive art, there are those who make ends meet by taking. Gain +1 Stealth and +1 Thievery

options.name: Trained in Magic
options.description: The elite of Goblin society are trained in powerful magic. Gain +1 Spell Attack and +1 Spell Damage.
